title: Persnickity wins Belmont feature
text:
Updated Oct 1, 2015 at 9:57p ET 
NEW YORK (AP) Persnickity beat Sustainable by two lengths Thursday in the $80,000 allowance feature for fillies and mares at Belmont Park. 
The race, originally scheduled for the turf, was switched to the main track which was labeled good. 
A gray 5-year-old trained by John Toscano, Persnickity kicked home on a three-wide rally for her eighth win in 40 starts. 
Kendrick Carmouche was aboard for the six furlongs in 1:09.65. 
Persnickity paid $9.30, $5 and $2.60. Sustainable returned $3.50 and $2.30, and Hillhouse High paid $2.50 to show.
